page.title: 19HERITAGE TRAIL
page.content: In July 1985 a Village Heritage Trail of Rosemarket was published by Pembrokeshire Coast National Park.The trail was prepared and written by the children of the Junior Class of Rosemarket School in July 1984.It was chosen as the best trail and printed by National Park as part of the prize. Both text and drawings are by the children.The booklets will be sold for 25p. each. The trail guides visitors to and gives the history of 1.THE RINGS where the first Rosemarket people lived. 2. THE CHURCH built c.1110.3.ST.LEONARD'S WELL a holy well.4.CROSS FARM CELLAR - a Medieval undercroft.5.THE MEDIEVAL DOVECOT.6.UPPER CROSSING COTTAGE - where the Railway gatekeeper lived.7. THE CHAPEL- built in 1831.8.ROSEMARKET SCHOOL- built 1860.9.THE VILLAGE HALL and 10.THE BEACON .
